title: I, Claudius (Novel)
brief_historiography_note: Graves's novel established the modern 'poisoner Livia' archetype, heavily influencing all subsequent media portrayals of the Julio-Claudian era.
creator: Robert Graves

title: I, Claudius (BBC TV Series)
brief_historiography_note: This definitive BBC production defined the visual and performative language of the Roman Imperial family for a generation.
creator: Jack Pulman

title: Cleopatra
brief_historiography_note: A monumental Hollywood epic focusing on the romantic-political transition from Republic to Empire.
creator: Joseph L. Mankiewicz

title: Quo Vadis
brief_historiography_note: The definitive cinematic portrayal of Nero's decadence and the Great Fire of Rome.
creator: Mervyn LeRoy

title: The Robe
brief_historiography_note: Groundbreaking widescreen epic exploring Caligula's madness and early Christian interaction with the Empire.
creator: Henry Koster
